Contributor: Roberts & Leete, printer.; Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee, publisher.;
Description: Text says that the Military Service Act of 1916 applies to unmarried men who on August 15th, 1915 were 18 years of age and over to age 41. All men not excepted or exempted between the ages above, will be deemed to be enlisted on Thursday, March 2nd, 1916. Text says to not wait but to enlist now. No pictorial content.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Series: Poster (Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee) ; no. 153.
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.
Physical Description: 1 poster : blue and grey ; 101 x 64 cm.

Title: The Military Service Act, 1916
